Description: Two fragments of an Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; rim fragment glazed inside with reserved band; outside, below rim, diagonal laurel leaf frieze with berries; below, head of a female with stephane, looking to left; uncertain object to right, probably torch. Lower body fragment (two joining sherds), band with meander and squares below figures: female figure in long dress with himation standing frontal; to the right part of the winged car of Triptolemos.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: San el-Hagar (Tanis) (? according to MFA and Fairbanks, from 'San' in Egypt)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 129, pl. XXXIX, no. 359.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1003)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
